page.title: 03ECONOMICS
page.content: In Alness there are three banks and a Girobank run through the Post Office. The three banks are:The Clydesdale Bank P.L.C, The Bank of Scotland and The Royal Bank of Scotland. The Bank of Scotland:is a small bank with four tellers. It has a night safe. This bank is situated at the West end of the High Street. The Royal Bank of Scotland: is in the centre of the town. It has incorporated the idea of using the modern "cashline" system, when the bank is closed. The Clydesdale Bank: is a modern building situated at the far East end of the High Street. There are two building societies both situated in the High Street. The two companies are the Leeds and the Halifax. The Northern Insurance Company is found in the same building.
